contents.contents: Stop for a few minutes to watch  the Durteint river (on your left).
This river was very useful for the people of Provins who washed their clothes and dyed their wool in it. The water gave a particular blue colour to the wool called “bleu ners” (dark blue).

question.contents: In your opinion, why can the river be dangerous for the inhabitants who live next to it?

explanations.contents: Even if all these risks are real, the city was raised to avoid frequent flooding.
